Package gw.pl.util

Class CollectionUtil

java.lang.Object
gw.pl.util.CollectionUtil
public class CollectionUtil extends Object
Utilities to do typed get/set on a java.util.Map

    • mergeArrays

      public static Object[] mergeArrays(Object[] array1, Object[] array2)
      Merges the contents of 2 arrays. The objects within the original arrays aren't cloned, the new merged array contains the same objects from array1 followed by the same objects from array2.
      Returns:
      Merger of array1 and array2 - unless array1 and array2 are both null, return null; or if one of array1 or array2 is null (but not both) return the non-null array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if array1 and array2 aren't of the same type.

    • addArrayElementsToList

      public static void addArrayElementsToList(Object[] arr, List list)
      Adds all the elements in the passed Object array into the passed List.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array whose elements should be added to the list.
      list - the list to which the method should add the array's elements.

    • extractArrayListRange

      public static ArrayList extractArrayListRange(ArrayList sourceList, int startIndex, int endIndex)
      Extracts a portion of an ArrayList into a new ArrayList (using shallow copy).
      Parameters:
      sourceList - The master list, from which to extract. If this list is empty, the method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
      startIndex - The point in the master list to start extracting from. This value must be > -1, or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
      endIndex - The point in the master list to stop extracting; this value must be invalid input: '<'= the size of the master list, or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the specified set of elements.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the sourceList is null, or the startIndex and endIndex arguments are invalid.

    • asList

      public static List asList(Object object)
      Converts a given object to a list, as follows:
      • If the object is null, returns an empty list
      • If the object is a list returns it as is
      • If the object is an array returns Arrays.asList(array)
      • If the object is a collection returns a list containing the elements of the collection
      • If all else fails returns a singleton list containing the object
      The returned list is not guaranteed to be modifiable - copy it into an ArrayList (new ArrayList(asList(object)) if you need to modify it.

    • toUnmodifiableCopy

      public static Map toUnmodifiableCopy(Map map)
      Returns an unmodifiable copy of the given Map. The returned Map will not be backed by the input Map, so the input Map can be subsequently modified without affecting the returned Map. Optimized for null, empty, or singleton Maps.

    • asSortedList

      public static List asSortedList(Object object, Comparator comp)
      Like asList, but returns the List in a sorted order as according to the passed-in Comparator. The original object is _not_ sorted, only the output.

    • hasDuplicates

      public static boolean hasDuplicates(Object[] objects)
      Checks to see if two objects in the given Object array are the same. Adds each object to a HashSet, and if the HashSet.add() method returns false (ie, the object was already in the set), then return true.

    • hasDuplicates

      public static boolean hasDuplicates(Object[] objects, org.apache.commons.collections4.Transformer keyGenerator)
      Checks to see if two objects in a given Object array are the same. Uses the given Transformer instance to build the key for each object.

    • toNewlineDelimitedString

      public static String toNewlineDelimitedString(Map map)
      Returns a string representation of the given map, in which each entry is separate by a newline. Useful for IntelliJ debugging. To use in the debugger, create a new watch with the value
      "com.guidewire.pl.system.util.CollectionUtil.toNewlineDelimitedString(<map variable>)"
      After the watch is evaluated, hover over the string and a tooltip should appear with the each entry in the map on a separate line.

      public static <T> int iteratorSize(Iterator<T> it)
      Returns the number of elements (remaining) in the iterator it. This method has the side-effect of exhausting the iterator. Requires it to be non-null.

    • join

      public static String join(Collection<?> c, String joinString)
      Creates a String that's the concatenation of all of the Objects in the Collection with the joinString added after each element (except for after the last element). Nulls are emitted as the String "null". Also see join(java.util.Collection, String, String).

      For example: 

       Collection c = Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c");
 String s = join(c, ",");
      returns: 
       "a,b,c"
      And 
       Collection c = Arrays.asList("a", null, "c");
 String s = join(c, "-");
      returns: 
        "a-null-c"
      Parameters:
      c - the collection of (possibly null) objects
      joinString - the separator that will appear after each object in the collection, except for after the last one.
      Returns:
      The concatenated String of the Objects' toString() with separators.

    • join

      public static String join(Collection<?> c, String joinString, String lastJoinString)
      Creates a String that's the concatenation of all of the Objects in the Collection with the joinString added after the first, but before all but the last element, where the lastJoinString is used. Nulls are emitted as the String "null". Also see join(java.util.Collection, String).

      For example: 

       Collection c = Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c");
 String s = join(c, ",", " and ");
      returns: 
       "a,b and c"
      And 
       Collection c = Arrays.asList("a", null, "c");
 String s = join(c, ",", " and ");
      returns: 
        "a,null and c"
      Parameters:
      c - the collection of (possibly null) objects
      joinString - the separator that will appear after each object in the collection, except for the last one.
      lastJoinString - the last separator used between the 2nd-to-last element and the last element.
      Returns:
      The concatenated String of the Objects' toString() with separators.

    • newHashSet

      public static HashSet newHashSet(Object[] values)
      Creates a new HashSet and populates it with all the values from the given array.

    • getFilteredAndSortedItems

      @Deprecated public static List getFilteredAndSortedItems(Object[] items, org.apache.commons.collections4.Predicate predicate, Comparator comparator)
      Deprecated.
      Use getFilteredAndSortedArray instead Creates a new list, then filters, sorts, and returns it. Does not modify original array.

    • getFilteredAndSortedArray

      public static List getFilteredAndSortedArray(Object[] items, Predicate predicate, Comparator comparator)

    • getFilteredAndSortedItems

      @Deprecated public static List getFilteredAndSortedItems(List items, org.apache.commons.collections4.Predicate predicate, Comparator comparator)
      Deprecated.
      Use getFilteredAndSortedList instead Filters and sorts the given list in place, and returns a pointer to the filtered and sorted list

    • getFilteredAndSortedList

      public static List getFilteredAndSortedList(List items, Predicate predicate, Comparator comparator)
      Filters and sorts the given list in place, and returns a pointer to the filtered and sorted list

    • compactAndLockHashMap

      public static <S, T> Map<S,T> compactAndLockHashMap(HashMap<S,T> map)
      Returns a compacted and locked map representing the map passed in. This method can freely change the implementation type of the map. I.e. it can return an emptyMap, singletonMap, or even a completely different map implementation.

    • compactAndLockList

      public static <T> List<T> compactAndLockList(List<T> list)

    • startsWith

      public static boolean startsWith(List<?> list, List<?> prefix)
      String.startsWith(String) for Lists.
      Returns:
      true iff list is at least as big as prefix, and if the first prefix.size() elements are element-wise equal to the elements of prefix.
